It belongs to the family Polypodiaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, shield-shaped fronds that are densely covered with tiny, scale-like structures. The plant thrives in humid, shaded environments and requires high atmospheric moisture to flourish. Its reproductive structures, known as sori, are typically found on the underside of its leaves, contributing to its reproductive strategy. Due to its limited geographic range and habitat specificity, Amauropelta venturae is considered a vulnerable species.
